main event: Several observers reported sighting unidentified flying objects in New Orleans, Louisiana on various dates in May 1949, with descriptions indicating they were disc-shaped, silver in color, and exhibiting unusual flight characteristics.
interesting points: The sightings involved both single and multiple objects, with reports of maneuvers and speeds similar to small aircraft., Observers described a luminous quality to the objects, with one witness comparing its size to that of a dinner plate., A total of these sightings involved multiple credible witnesses including a professor from Tulane University., The reports were taken seriously enough to be classified and forwarded to high-ranking military officials., The detailed accounts included information on weather conditions and the reliability of the witnesses.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects possibly disc-shaped and silver in color
witness description: Housewives and a professor, characterized as reliable and of average or above-average intelligence.
